column1: Usually the access is put in your arm but it can also go in your leg.
Central venous catheter: - If you need hemodialysis right away and you do not have time to wait for a fistula or graft to work, the surgeon can put in a catheter.
- The catheter is put into a vein in the neck, chest, or upper leg.
It can be used for dialysis while you wait for a fistula or graft to heal.
